title: `fs::read_dir` loops infinitely when used in Node.js WASI environment
body:
First of all, I am not sure whether this is a problem of Rust side or Node.js side. I was not able to investigate further, asking for help here :cry:

**Code:**

```rust
use std::{env, fs, io};

fn main() -> io::Result<()> {
    println!("Calling fs::read_dir");
    for entry in fs::read_dir(env::current_dir()?)? {
        let entry = entry?;
        println!("Entry {}", entry.path().display());
    }
    Ok(())
}
```

Compiled to target `wasm32-wasi`, above code runs correctly (prints all entries in the current directory and terminates) when run with `wasmtime`. Example output:

```
Calling fs::read_dir
Entry /run-node-wasi.mjs
Entry /Cargo.toml
Entry /run-wasmtime-wasi.sh
Entry /target
Entry /Cargo.lock
Entry /README.md
Entry /.gitignore
Entry /.git
Entry /src
```

However, when the same code is run with Node.js' WASI implementation ( https://nodejs.org/dist/latest-v18.x/docs/api/wasi.html ), `fs::read_dir` iterates indefinitely:

```
Calling fs::read_dir
Entry /run-node-wasi.mjs
Entry /Cargo.toml
Entry /run-wasmtime-wasi.sh
Entry /run-node-wasi.mjs
Entry /Cargo.toml
Entry /run-wasmtime-wasi.sh
Entry /run-node-wasi.mjs
Entry /Cargo.toml
Entry /run-wasmtime-wasi.sh
Entry /run-node-wasi.mjs
Entry /Cargo.toml
Entry /run-wasmtime-wasi.sh
Entry /run-node-wasi.mjs
Entry /Cargo.toml
Entry /run-wasmtime-wasi.sh
Entry /run-node-wasi.mjs
Entry /Cargo.toml
Entry /run-wasmtime-wasi.sh
Entry /run-node-wasi.mjs
……
```

### Meta

I prepared a reproduction repository with a set of instructions to reproduce the problem:

https://github.com/uhyo/rust-wasi-readdir

`rustc --version --verbose`:
